com.brashmonkey.spriter

Class TweenedAnimation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.brashmonkey.spriter.Animation
      • com.brashmonkey.spriter.TweenedAnimation

  • public class TweenedAnimation
extends Animation
    A tweened animation is responsible for updating itself based on two given animations. The values of the two given animations will get interpolated and save in this animation. When tweening two animations, you have to make sure that they have the same structure. The best result is achieved if bones of two different animations are named in the same way. There are still issues with sprites, which are hard to resolve since Spriter does not save them in a useful order or naming convention.

    • Field Detail

      • weight

        public float weight
        The weight of the interpolation. 0.5f is the default value. Values closer to 0.0f mean the first animation will have more influence.

      • spriteThreshold

        public float spriteThreshold
        Indicates when a sprite should be switched form the first animation object to the second one. A value closer to 0.0f means that the sprites of the second animation will be drawn.

      • curve

        public final Curve curve
        The curve which will tween the animations. The default type of the curve is Curve.Type.Linear.

      • entity

        public final Entity entity
        The entity the animations have be part of. Animations of two different entities can not be tweened.

      • baseAnimation

        public Animation baseAnimation
        The base animation an object or bone will get if it will not be tweened.

      • tweenSprites

        public boolean tweenSprites
        Indicates whether to tween sprites or not. Default value is false. Tweening sprites should be only enabled if they have exactly the same structure. If all animations are bone based and sprites only change their references it is not recommended to tween sprites.

      • update

        public void update(int time,
                   Timeline.Key.Bone root)
        Description copied from class: Animation
        Updates the bone and object structure with the given time to the given root bone.
        Overrides:
        update in class Animation
        Parameters:
        time - The time which has to be between 0 and Animation.length to work properly.
        root - The root bone which is not allowed to be null. The whole animation runs relative to the root bone.

        public boolean onFirstMainLine()
